sentences.english: A blate cat makes a proud mouse.
I forgot about the outro, my shyness at that time couldn't of been captured better.
sentences.chinese: 我把结尾那段都忘了，那真是拍上了我当时的腼腆。

sentences.english: My shy little sister clung to me like aleechall through the party.
sentences.chinese: 我那腼腆的小妹在聚会上寸步不离地跟着我。

sentences.english: The thirty or so Kenyan women standing around are curious, and openly gawking.
sentences.chinese: 大约30个肯尼亚女人站在周围，她们又好奇又腼腆。

sentences.english: She was a woman of many blushes and very few words.
I like the girls who are shy and stand off.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢那些腼腆不愿与人接触的女孩们。

sentences.english: Bobby looked at her with a sheepish grin.
sentences.chinese: 博比望着她腼腆地咧嘴一笑。

sentences.english: She says that Sellers later chided her for being timid.
sentences.chinese: 她表示，赛乐之后曾责备她过于腼腆。

sentences.english: Bostonians' reserved demeanor had bothered him for years.
sentences.chinese: 多年来他一直对波士顿人腼腆的性格耿耿于怀。

sentences.english: Cody smiled shyly, gripping my hand for dear life.
sentences.chinese: 科迪腼腆地微笑着，紧紧地抓住我的手。

sentences.english: I glanced over at him as the woman departed. He looked sheepish but pleased.
sentences.chinese: 女人走后我瞥了他一眼，他看起来腼腆又愉快。

sentences.english: But in the corner of your sight, my bashfulness is hardly to ignore.
sentences.chinese: 但在你眼角的馀光里，却是难以忽视的腼腆。

sentences.english: Mary is very quiet,try to fetch out at the party.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽非常腼腆，设法鼓励她在聚会上开口说话。

sentences.english: Li Xiang is an undemonstrative person.
Cody was a timid, small child.

definition: (of a person's manner or character) gentle and quiet
affecting shyness or embarrassment/coy/mincing (walk, manner of speech)/mannered
spacious and well-lit/open and clear/(of character) optimistic/cheerful/carefree
